    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Description copied from interface: EntityPropertyDescriptor
        Get the property descriptor path. For simple properties this usually corresponds with the property name. For nested properties this is the full property path, optionally with member descriptors.

        Use EntityPropertyDescriptor.getTargetPropertyName() to retrieve the exact property name this descriptor represents.

        Specified by:
        getName in interface EntityPropertyDescriptor
        Returns:
        Property name.

      • getTargetPropertyName

        public String getTargetPropertyName()
        Description copied from interface: EntityPropertyDescriptor
        Get the target property name that this property descriptor represents. In case of a simple property this is the same as EntityPropertyDescriptor.getName(), but for nested properties this will remove the path representing the parent property.

        For example, suppose the descriptor is user.name, which represents a nested property descriptor with parent descriptor user. In this case the target property name would be user.

        Specified by:
        getTargetPropertyName in interface EntityPropertyDescriptor
        Returns:
        target property name

      • getPropertyValue

        public Object getPropertyValue(Object entity)
        Description copied from interface: EntityPropertyDescriptor
        Retrieve the property value for the entity parameter. This is basically the same as calling #getValueFetcher()#getValue, except null will be returned if no ValueFetcher is available.
        Specified by:
        getPropertyValue in interface EntityPropertyDescriptor
        Parameters:
        entity - from which to get the property value
        Returns:
        property value or null if unable to get
